adjective.description: Designed to correct or counteract something harmful or undesirable.
examples: management was informed so that corrective action could be taken

noun.description: A thing intended to correct or counteract something else.
examples: the move might be a corrective to some inefficient practices within hospitals

origin: Mid 16th century: from French correctif, -ive or late Latin correctivus, from Latin correct- brought into order from the verb corrigere (see correct).
